data.QuestionText: Does the solution integrate with specific Microsoft products?
data.FollowUps: Integrating with Team? Office 365? Dynamics? Azure? Windows? Xbox?

data.QuestionText: What are the goals for this engagement with OCP?
data.FollowUps: Where can OCP add value? What does a successful engagemen with OCP look like?
data.PotentialAnswers: Explaratory? Modernization strategy? Pricing? Bake-Off? Etc

data.QuestionText: When and how often will the project team be able to meet with Microsoft Technical resources?
data.FollowUps: Do you want to meet on a specific cadence as you build the project?

data.QuestionText: What tools are used for managing the solutiion software development?
data.FollowUps: What tools do you use (Azure Devops, Atlassian, Github, Jenkins, TeamCity, etc)?

data.QuestionText: How often is the solution updated/patched?
data.FollowUps: How often do you release updates to the solution? Do you have customized versions per customer?

data.QuestionText: What application servers does the solution use?
What industries does the solution serve?
data.FollowUps: What roles in that industry do customers have (e.g. in Healthcare: payer, provider, research, etc)?

data.QuestionText: test
Why are we moving the solution to Azure?
data.FollowUps: What are the business objectives? What are the quantifiable business goals? What outcomes are you hoping to achieve for customers?

data.QuestionText: How does the solution fit into the partnesrship with Microsoft?
data.FollowUps: Have you thought about how you would co-sell the solution with Microsoft? How does your solution complement Microsoft platforms and solutions?

data.QuestionText: Is the solution a candidate for Azure Marketplace?
data.FollowUps: Is deployment and configuration of the solution right for Azure Marketplace? Are you familiar with Azure Marketplace and all the options for deploying the solution there?

data.QuestionText: Is the goal to get the solution into our IP Co-Sell catalog?
data.FollowUps: Is your solution based on your proprietary IP? Is the deployment mostly a repeatable process based on the same IP?

data.QuestionText: Is the solution a candidate for App Source?
data.FollowUps: Do you allow customers to authenticate with Azure AD/Office 365? Does your solution require a custom implementation as part of the deployment?

data.QuestionText: Does this project have an executive sponsor from the Partner/Customer/or Microsoft
data.FollowUps: Who is responsible for making sure the project is staffed and funded? When do you expect to have that information or those decisions made? How can we help with that process?

data.QuestionText: Who is responsible for signing-off on the solution?
data.FollowUps: Do different people have different sign-off responsibilities? For example: Signing off on security, performance, compliance, etc? How else do you certify the solution meets architecture/regulation requirements?

data.QuestionText: Who/What Team owns the operationalization of the solution for customers?
data.FollowUps: Who will manage this when it is in Azure? Do you have an Ops team? Do you outsource Ops to a Managed Service Provider?
data.PotentialAnswers: In house ops team - outsourced to an MSP.

data.QuestionText: What resources are dedicated to the solution?
data.FollowUps: How many developers are on the solution team? How many QA, UX, Devops, etc resources? Where are the teams located?
data.PotentialAnswers: Team of developers, architects, testers, UX, etc

data.QuestionText: Who is the product owner of the solution?
data.FollowUps: Who decides what features get built? Who looks at the data the solution generates to decide what improvements to make and where to focus the team?

data.QuestionText: How do you utlize the data that the solution generates?
data.FollowUps: What do you do with all the data your application collects? Who owns which data: you, partners, customers? Are there rules on what you can do with the data? Are you interested in learning more about what we can do with the data?

data.QuestionText: Does the solution use any AI?
data.FollowUps: Do you build and train your own prediction models based on the data the solution generates? Do you have features inside the application that uses those predictions? Does the solution use public/generic datasets like senitment analysis, facial detection, voice recognition, etc?  Does the solution use AI features like bots, speech to text or text to speech? Do you want to learn more about Azure's AI capabilities for your solution?

data.QuestionText: Can the solution code be touched as part of the project?
data.FollowUps: Are there any "black boxes" in your code base? Is there anything we can't touch as part of deploying to Azure? Are there dependencies in your application that can be replaced with Azure services? Are there parts of the solution you want to explore for replacing with Azure services?

data.QuestionText: Is the solution deployed in various regions?
data.FollowUps: Do you want to deploy to various regions for geo-redundancy/high availability? Will you deploy to various regions to reduce latency to global customers? Will you offer different geo-redundancy options to customers? Does the solution run in active/active or active/passive?

data.QuestionText: Can you describe the tenancy model of the solution?
data.FollowUps: Are all customers deployed in the same tenant at every tier? Is there a shared front-end but separate backend (database) per customer? Is it a completely single-tenant application: each customer gets their own complete stack? What is the tenancy odel of ancillary services like storage, CDN, network, VMs, etc.? What is the tenancy model of supporting services like monitoring, backups, incident management, etc.
data.PotentialAnswers: It is multi-tenant, It is single tenant

data.QuestionText: How does the solution manage state?
data.FollowUps: Does it use cookies, a cache, SQL database, object storage, memory, etc? Are there opportunities to externalize state to an Azure service?

data.QuestionText: What is the tenancy model of the database?
data.FollowUps: Are customers in the same database tables with customerid fields in each row? Are customers in the same database but with their own tables, separated by schema? Do customers get separate databases but on the same server?
data.PotentialAnswers: Each customer gets a database; Customer data is in the same tables. Customers are in separate schemas.

data.QuestionText: Is the solution already hosted on a competitive platform like AWS or GCP?
data.FollowUps: What is the cost for running the solution on those other clouds? Do you have reference architectures available for those clouds?

data.QuestionText: Where is the solution on a scale of microservices to monolithic?
data.FollowUps: Can different components be deployed separately or scaled separately? Are some resources shared between customer instances (e.g. a logging micro service)? Are dependencies between components referenced as services over the network or referenced via libraries in code? Are the references hard-coded or do you implement dependency/package management?

data.QuestionText: How do you monitor the solution?
data.FollowUps: Do you use tools like New Relic or Splunk? What do you do with the logs the system generates? Do you have dahboards for monitoring system performance? Do you have performance benchmarks and generate alerts when performance deviates or faults are detected?

data.QuestionText: How do you measure application performance?
data.FollowUps: Do you use tools like New Relic or AppDynamics? Do you measure specific customer outcomes? Do you measure specific Quality metrics?

data.QuestionText: What is the Disaster Recovery Plan for the solution?
data.FollowUps: What is the backup strategy for the solution: How often do you take backups; how long do you keep them, where do you keep them? How easy it to redeploy the solution in another region?

data.QuestionText: What is the antiicpated monthly consumption for the solution on Azure?
data.FollowUps: Do you have reference architectures available for the solution today? What does a Small, Medium, Large customer deployment look like? How many VMs, Databases, etc? Are there architectures based on customer BCDR requirements?

data.QuestionText: What kind of data does the solution store?
data.FollowUps: Is it transactional data? Controlled data (e.g. PCI, PHI)> Binary data (e.g. PDFs, images, videos, etc)? Telemetry or click-stream data?

data.QuestionText: What tier does the solution belong to?
data.FollowUps: How mission critical is the solution for you customers? Is it an Analytics/Reporting solution? Is it a real-time system your customers use with their own end-customers? Is it an internal LOB application for you customers?

data.QuestionText: How much data does the solution generate?
data.FollowUps: Per day? Per month? Per customer? Per data type? What is the range/average? How long do you keep the data?

data.QuestionText: How is the solution architected for High Availability?
data.FollowUps: Is the application deployed to multiple VMs or containers? Can the application be load balanced? How tightly couple are all the application components (if one goes down, does everything else go down)?

data.QuestionText: What kind of access to the data does the solution enable for customers?
data.FollowUps: Can customers query the database directly? Do you provide backups of the database for customers to use locally? Do you provide APIs for customers to get the data? Do you dump out the data for customers to ingest into their own systems? Do you offer a report authoring environment (PowerBI, Tableau) for customers?
data.PotentialAnswers: We let customers connect to the database. We only let customers access tge data through the UI. Through an API.

data.QuestionText: What SLA does the solution provide to customers?
data.FollowUps: What is the Service Level Objective (SLO) or up-time you offer customers? What is the Recovery Time Objective (RTO)  and Recovery Point Objective (RPO) that you offer customers? How do you ensure you meet these SLAs?

data.QuestionText: Is the solution built and deployed with devops?
data.FollowUps: What does your deployment process look like? Is it automated? Do you use CI/CD? Do you use Canary Builds, Blue/Green Deployment, A/B Testing? How are issues/biugs in the deployed application looped back into the dev process?

data.QuestionText: How does the solution back up data?
data.FollowUps: What vendor(s) do you use for backing up the data? Are they full backups or differential? How often? Where are the backups stored? Is all the data backed up or just certain parts? How long are backups retained?

data.QuestionText: What kind of development methodology is used for building the solution?
data.FollowUps: Do you use Scrum, Agile, Waterfall, XP, etc? How long are the sprints? How are the dev teams organized? How often do you release new versions of the application?

data.QuestionText: How do users authenticate to the solution?
data.FollowUps: Do customers or regulations require MFA/2FA? Do you federate with social apps like Facebook, Google, Microsoft Account, LInkedIn? Do you store usernames/passwords inside of your application? Do you authenticate with industry standard protocols like OAUTH2 or OIDC?
data.PotentialAnswers: SSO, ADFS, Bespoke Identity Management System

data.QuestionText: What non-production environments do you have?
data.FollowUps: What lower environments do you use? Do you have customer-specific lower environments? Where do you do CI? Where do you do testing? How do you promote code to production? What is the sign-off/release process?

data.QuestionText: What services or applications does the solution integrate with?
data.FollowUps: SAP? Salesforce? Dynamics? Office? Are you concerned about these integrations when you move to Azure? Do you or your partners need to whitelist IP addresses as part of these integrations?

data.QuestionText: What vendor applications does the solution use for authentication?
data.FollowUps: Do you rely on a 3rd party for IAM or is it custom built? How easy would it be to replace with a solution from Azure? Does your solution enable your customers to let their own end-customers to authenticate?

data.QuestionText: What platform is the solution built on?
data.FollowUps: What version of the platform(s) are you using? Are those versions still supported or nearing end of service? Is there an opportunity to modernize some or all of the solution as you move to Azure? Does the solution support multiple platforms (e.g. Oracle and SQL Server?)
data.PotentialAnswers: Java, .NET, Open source, SQL Server, Oracle, Docker, Kubernetes, etc.

data.QuestionText: What is on the roadmap for the solution?
data.FollowUps: Next 3 months, 6 months? How do you determine the roadmap? Do you publish the roadmap? Where does the Azure project fit on the roadmap?

data.QuestionText: What is the solution's environment governance scheme
data.FollowUps: Who owns access/control to the solution's environment? What identities are being used, what policies are being used? How do you control access to each environment?

data.QuestionText: What is the timeline for this project?
data.FollowUps: Will you move certain parts of the solution at a time (phased approach)? What is influencing the timeline for the project? Do you want to make an announcement at conference?
data.PotentialAnswers: Phase 1 – lift and shift, Phase 2 – low hanging fruit for PaaS, Phase 3 – rewrite for cloud native, etc.

data.QuestionText: What are the solution's encryption requirements? What kind of encryption does the solution require? Is encryption required on the disks or just in the database?
data.FollowUps: Encryption in transite? Encryption at rest?

data.QuestionText: Where do you store secrets?
data.FollowUps: Do you use an out-of-process key management solution? Are keys stored in the application? In configuration? In Source Code?

data.QuestionText: Are there any special industry/compliance security requirements?
data.FollowUps: What industries does the solution serve? Are there government or industry regulations/standards that have to be followed? How will we address this in Azure?

data.QuestionText: What are the solution's Firewall, IDP, IDS requirements?
data.FollowUps: What drives these requiremetns? Which vendor products do you use for managing these requirements? How integrated are vendor products into your solution? How will the licensing for these solutions work in Azure?

data.QuestionText: What are your log retention policies?
data.FollowUps: Are there  industry/compliance requirements or customer requirements? Have you thought a strategy for optimally storing logs in Azure?

data.QuestionText: What general security requirements does the solution have?
data.FollowUps: What is your security architecture? What are your privacy requirements/policies?  How do you approach pen testing, malware, OWASP, phishing, social engineering, etc?

data.QuestionText: Who will be implementing this project?
data.FollowUps: Is there a team dedicated to this project? Who are they, where are they located? Are you engaging a systems integrator or consultant to do the work?

data.QuestionText: How do you support customers using the solution?
data.FollowUps: Do you have a dedicated support organization? Do you use an ITSM vendor like Zendesk or ServiceNow? What support procedures do you have in place? How will that transfer to Azure?

data.QuestionText: How do users interact with the solution?
data.FollowUps: Is there a UX/Web front-end? Is there a Mobile app? Does the solution provide APIs? Is the solution surfaced inside other products? Is the solution white-labeled?

data.QuestionText: What is the team's current skill level with Azure?
data.FollowUps: Has anyone taken Azure certification exams? Does the team or anyone on the team have experience working with Azure?  Are you aware of Azure learning and training resources?

data.QuestionText: Are the solution's usage and traffic patterns predictable?
data.FollowUps: Are there unpredictable spikes in the usage of the solution? Does the load on the system follow any patterns? Are patterns determined by customer size or location or use-case?

data.QuestionText: Is the solution running "real time"?
data.FollowUps: Is it a batch solution that runs "offline" and produces data or artifacts that are used in another system?

data.QuestionText: What are the strategic advantages of the solution (compared to competitors)?
data.FollowUps: What is the strategy of your solution in the Marketplace? Do you have differentiated solution?  See Porter's Generic Strategies: https://www.mindtools.com/pages/article/newSTR_82.htm

data.QuestionText: Who are the solution's competitors? *NOTE* This might not always be appropriate, see Follow Ups
data.FollowUps: Are you seeing disruption in the market for your solution? Are the new challenges in the market for this solution? Are customers finding new "substitutes" for your solution? How can Azure make your solution more competitive? See Porter's 5 Forces: https://www.mindtools.com/pages/article/newTMC_08.htm

data.QuestionText: Is this an internal line of business solution or is it external facing?
data.FollowUps: Is the solution a Line of Business application for your customers? Do your customers rely on the solution to provide services to their own end-customers?

data.QuestionText: Is there a deal or customer opportunity associated with the project for running the solution in Azure?
data.FollowUps: Have customers told you that they want the solution in Azure/the Cloud?  Do you have customers waiting for an Azure based solution? Are customers willing to work with you to pilot the solution in Azure?

data.QuestionText: Do customers host the solution themselves?
data.FollowUps: Do you offer a hosting service? If it's hosted, - where is it hosted? If, it's in a competitor cloud, what does it cost today?

data.QuestionText: Do you currently host the solution on behalf of some/all customers?
data.FollowUps: Will you be migrating existing customers to the cloud? Is the cloud solution for new customers only? Will you continue to onboard customers into your existing datacenter? Is the cloud only for certain kind of customers?

data.QuestionText: What kinds of customers does the solution have?
data.FollowUps: Are they very large Enterprise customers? Small and medium business size customers? Individuals/Consumers?  Government or other Public Sector (Military) customers? Education or Non profit? Are they also Microsoft customers?

data.QuestionText: How long is a typical sales cycle for the solution?
data.FollowUps: What are the pain points in the sales cycle? Will moving to the cloud speed up sales or help convert more customers?

data.QuestionText: How is the solution sold?
data.FollowUps: Going forward, will this become a cloud/SAAS only solution?
data.PotentialAnswers: Subscription: per-user, per month? By transaction? By business outcomes?  License based? By instances, by VM Core?  Embedded/White Labeled?

data.QuestionText: Do customers work with partners to implement and manage the solution?
data.FollowUps: Who are the partners? Are they also Microsoft partners? What does a typical enagement look like? Is it important that partners are also aware of how to implement the solution on Azure?

data.QuestionText: Are the solution's customers already using Azure?
data.FollowUps: Are customers already comfortable with Azure and the cloud? Are your customers already using services like M/O/D 365?

data.QuestionText: Is the solution delivered in different offerings or tiers?
data.FollowUps: Are there standard t-shirt sized offerings for the solution? Do you turn on different features at different tiers? Are their support or BCDR differences per tier?
